Brief: 
		Learn the FERC and CFTC compliance rules for energy trading. Work 
		through the FERC?s anti-manipulation rule and compare it to the CFTC?s 
		anti-manipulation rule. Review the capacity release rules, and the 
		regulations on ?front running? and all the other compliance rules 
		applicable to energy trading and marketing. Apply all the foregoing to 
		compliance games-based on real life trading scenarios from the trading 
		desks of the biggest energy traders in the business.


Who Would Benefit 
		from attendance:
		Compliance staff, credit staff, lawyers, operations staff, research 
		staff and traders.
Cost: $797 Full Day Seminar - 8:30 
		am - 4 pm


      FERC and CFTC Agenda
1. - Introductions

		2. - Overview of Energy Trading & Marketing (Swaps, Forwards and 
		Futures, Futures and Over-the-counter Markets, Participants in Wholesale 
		Markets, True/False Challenge)

		3. - Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (Jurisdiction of the FERC, 
		FERC Commissioners and Enforcement Staff, Gas and Power Regulation, 
		Capacity Release Rules, Anti-Manipulation Rule under EPA of 2005, 
		Anti-Manipulation Training Exercise, True/False Challenge)

		4. - Commodity Futures Trading Commission
		(Jurisdiction of the CFTC, CFTC Commissioners and Enforcement Staff, Use 
		of Inside Information and Front Running, Market Manipulation and Fraud, 
		Commodity Futures Modernization Act of 2000,Overview of Current CFTC 
		Litigation, True/False Challenge)

		5. - Case Studies and Training Games (2:45 to 4:00)
